meanings.sent1: The homology of the twins was evident in their identical appearance.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the homology between different species to understand their evolutionary relationships.
meanings.sent3: The homology between the two puzzle pieces made them fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent4: The homology in their thought processes allowed them to communicate effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The homology of the fingerprints helped solve the crime mystery.

meanings.definition: A similarity in structure between parts of different organisms, indicating common ancestry.
meanings.sent1: The homology of the bird's wing to the bat's wing suggests a shared evolutionary history.
meanings.sent2: Biologists use homology to trace the evolutionary relationships between various species.
meanings.sent3: The homology between the cat's whiskers and the spider's legs was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The homology in their architectural styles reflected a deep cultural connection.
meanings.sent5: The homology of the skeletons revealed a surprising link between the two species.

meanings.definition: Correspondence in position or structure between parts of the same organism.
meanings.sent1: The homology of the leaves on the tree showed perfect symmetry.
meanings.sent2: Botanists study the homology of plant structures to understand their functions.
meanings.sent3: The homology between the cat's ears and tail was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The homology of their dance moves made them the perfect dance partners.
meanings.sent5: The homology in the design of the building elements created a harmonious look.
